intro: Arjonaea, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly the highlands of Ethiopia and Kenya. The plants are characterized by their velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. Arjonaea species are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive appearance and ease of care. They thrive in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil.
